publications: [{"title":"Testing the efficiency of the Indian Stock Markets during COVID-19","subtitle":"Delhi Business Review","date":"March 10, 2022","description":"The aim of this paper is to assess the Weak Form Efficiency of Indian Stock Markets during the COVID 19 Pandemic. Daily data of 10 indices has been gathered for a period of 15 months from March, 2020 to May, 2021. Statistical tests like Runs test, Autocorrelation Functions, Correlograms and Box Pierce test have been used to evaluate efficiency levels. Market efficiency is fairly important for various market players as it is an indicator on which they base their investment decision. The conclusion found was that the Indian Stock market was found to be inefficientduring the Covid 19 Pandemic."}]
